detaileddescription.para: It will fall back to the default theme if the active theme does not have the required icon. Cursors are automatically scaled to look like a 16px cursor on 96dpi screens.

This string is used to represent the value NULL throughout QGIS.

detaileddescription.para: In general, when passing values around, prefer to use a null QVariant QVariant( field.type() ) or QVariant( QVariant::Int ). This value should only be used in the final presentation step when showing values in a widget or sending it to a web browser.

briefdescription.para: Returns a string name of the operating system QGIS is running on.
Returns the application's page size registry, used for managing layout page sizes.
Returns the application's paint effect registry, used for managing paint effects.
Returns the common root path of all application data directories.
Returns the QGIS platform name, e.g., "desktop" or "server".
Returns the application's plugin layer registry, used for managing plugin layer types.

Returns the path to the application prefix directory.
Returns the application's processing registry, used for managing processing providers, algorithms, and various parameters and outputs.

detaileddescription.para: Returns empty string when QGIS is built without Quick support

briefdescription.para: Returns the application's raster renderer registry, used for managing raster layer renderers.
Register OGR drivers ensuring this only happens once.

detaileddescription.para: This is a workaround for an issue with older gdal versions that caused duplicate driver name entries to appear in the list of registered drivers when QgsApplication::registerOgrDrivers was called multiple times.

briefdescription.para: Converts path relative to target to an absolute path.
Returns registry of available 3D renderers.
Returns the application's renderer registry, used for managing vector layer renderers.
Returns a standard css style sheet for reports.

detaileddescription.para: Typically you will use this method by doing: QString myStyle = QgsApplication::reportStyleSheet(); textBrowserReport->document()->setDefaultStyleSheet(myStyle);

simplesect.para: QString containing the CSS 2.1 compliant stylesheet.
you can use the special Qt extensions too, for example the gradient fills for backgrounds.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the application pkg path.
Sets the GDAL_SKIP environment variable to exclude the specified driver and then calls GDALDriverManager::AutoSkipDrivers() to unregister it.

detaileddescription.para: The driver name should be the short format of the Gdal driver name e.g. GTIFF.

briefdescription.para: Returns the path to the server resources directory.

briefdescription.para: Alters default svg paths - used by 3rd party apps.

briefdescription.para: This string is used to represent the value NULL throughout QGIS.

detaileddescription.para: In general, when passing values around, prefer to use a null QVariant QVariant( field.type() ) or QVariant( QVariant::Int ). This value should only be used in the final presentation step when showing values in a widget or sending it to a web browser.

briefdescription.para: Alters pkg data path - used by 3rd party apps.
Alters plugin path - used by 3rd party apps.
Alters prefix path - used by 3rd party apps.
Set the active theme to the specified theme.

detaileddescription.para:
The theme name should be a single word e.g. 'default','classic'. The theme search path usually will be pkgDataPath + "/themes/" + themName + "/" but plugin writers etc can use themeName() as a basis for searching for resources in their own datastores e.g. a Qt4 resource bundle.
A basic test will be carried out to ensure the theme search path based on the supplied theme name exists. If it does not the theme name will be reverted to 'default'.

briefdescription.para: Set translation.
Set the current UI theme used to style the interface.

detaileddescription.para:
Use uiThemes() to find valid themes to use. Variables found in variables.qss will be added to the stylesheet on load.
themeName
The name of the theme.
using an invalid theme name will reset to default

briefdescription.para: Returns the short name regular expression for line edit validator.
Convenience function to get a summary of the paths used in this application instance useful for debugging mainly.
Sets the GDAL_SKIP environment variable to include the specified driver and then calls GDALDriverManager::AutoSkipDrivers() to unregister it.

detaileddescription.para: The driver name should be the short format of the Gdal driver name e.g. GTIFF.

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of gdal drivers that should be skipped (based on GDAL_SKIP environment variable)

Returns the application's task manager, used for managing application wide background task handling.
Set the active theme to the specified theme.

detaileddescription.para: The theme name should be a single word e.g. 'default','classic'. The theme search path usually will be pkgDataPath + "/themes/" + themName + "/" but plugin writers etc can use this method as a basis for searching for resources in their own datastores e.g. a Qt4 resource bundle.

All themes found in ~/.qgis3/themes folder.

detaileddescription.para:

briefdescription.para: Emitted when project strings which require translation are being collected for inclusion in a .ts file.

detaileddescription.para: In order to register translatable strings, connect to this signal and register the strings within the specified translationContext.

briefdescription.para: True when running from build directory, i.e. without 'make install'.
Path to the source directory. valid only when running from build directory.
Path to the output directory of the build. valid only when running from build directory.
List of gdal drivers to be skipped.

detaileddescription.para:
Uses GDAL_SKIP to exclude them.
skipGdalDriver, restoreGdalDriver

briefdescription.para: Extends QApplication to provide access to QGIS specific resources such as theme paths, database paths etc.

detaileddescription.para: This is a subclass of QApplication and should be instantiated in place of QApplication. Most methods are static in keeping with the design of QApplication.

This class hides platform-specific path information and provides a portable way of referencing specific files and directories. Ideally, hard-coded paths should appear only here and not in other modules so that platform-conditional code is minimized and paths are easier to change due to centralization.
